intro: Diospyros calcarea, commonly known as the limestone persimmon, is a species of flowering plant in the Ebenaceae family. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in clusters. Its fruit is a small, edible drupe that turns from green to reddish when mature. Diospyros calcarea is often found growing in rocky or limestone-rich soils, reflecting its adaptability to specific environmental conditions.
